programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: (1952) Civil War-era Western. A unit of Confederate soldiers attack a Union troop to steal gold. Learning that the war is over, they must finish the mission in disguise.

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: (1948) Anthony Asquith's drama based on a famous 1912 court case with Cedric Hardwicke as the father of a boy accused of theft who pursues the case to the highest courts. With Robert Donat.

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: (1960) Classic crime thriller with Stanley Baker and Billie Whitelaw. A world-weary detective with a messy private life tracks a violent thief through the streets of Manchester.

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: (1968) Burt Lancaster stars as the angst-ridden middle-aged man who decides to swim home via neighbour's pools in Frank and Eleanor Perry's superb allegorical drama.

programme.title: A Room with a View
programme.desc: (1985) Helena Bonham Carter stars in this Merchant/Ivory film as an innocent on holiday in Florence, where a meeting with Julian Sands leads to romance.

programme.title: Transporter 3
programme.desc: (2008) Violent action-thriller with Jason Statham. Terrorists hire a courier to drive a kidnapped woman across Europe, on a journey that gets ever more dangerous.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: (2014) World War II action with Brad Pitt. A tank commander leads his crew into the dark, bloody heart of Hitler's last stand. But there's a rookie on board the Fury. With Michael Peña.

programme.title: Monos
programme.desc: (2019) Alejandro Landes's hallucinatory war film. A ragtag band of teenage soldiers, who live on a mountaintop in Latin America, guard an American hostage with their lives. In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill

programme.title: Against the Wind

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: Notting Hill

programme.title: This Is England
programme.desc: (2006) Shane Meadows' award-winning drama starring Thomas Turgoose. In the 1980s, a bullied 13-year-old finds friendship with a group of skinheads. But one of them is also a violent racist.

programme.title: Boiling Point
programme.desc: (2021) Stephen Graham stars as a top chef spiralling inexorably towards destruction, as his life descends into chaos over one night's service at a fancy London restaurant.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: (2000) Christopher Nolan's Oscar-nominated thriller with Guy Pearce. A man tracking his wife's killer has no short-term memory so must find other ways to piece together the evidence.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: (1957) The final Ealing comedy stars Alec Guinness as the latest in a long and distinguished line of sailors, but there's a problem: he suffers from seasickness. So why not buy a pier?

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: (1964) Classic British dark comedy with Alan Bates and Denholm Elliott. An ambitious estate agent's clerk hires a toff to teach him to be posh. Couldn't possibly lead to murder, could it?

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: (1999) Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts star in the BAFTA-winning comedy romance about a bookshop owner who manages to get a glamorous movie star to go out with him. With Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: This Is England
programme.desc: (2006) Shane Meadows' award-winning drama starring Thomas Turgoose. In the 1980s, a bullied 13-year-old finds friendship with a group of skinheads. But one of them is also a violent racist.

programme.title: Boiling Point
programme.desc: (2021) Stephen Graham stars as a top chef spiralling inexorably towards destruction, as his life descends into chaos over one night's service at a fancy London restaurant.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: (2000) Christopher Nolan's Oscar-nominated thriller with Guy Pearce. A man tracking his wife's killer has no short-term memory so must find other ways to piece together the evidence.

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: (1952) Poignant Ealing drama starring seven-year-old Mandy Miller as a deaf girl whose parents - played by Phyllis Calvert and Terence Morgan - fight over her treatment.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: (1947) Drama with Derek Bond, based on Charles Dickens' novel. After his father dies, Nicholas seeks the help of his cold, avaricious, scheming uncle. Predictably, it doesn't go well.
